text: We next analyzed whether promoter methylation could be responsible for down-regulation of <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .
A region including exon1 in the <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter exhibited a large number of CpG - rich sequences ( Figure 3A ) .

Several chemical substances such as 5-aza-2-deoxycytidine ( AzadC ) or 5-azacytidine ( AzaC ) inhibit de novo and maintenance methylation , and thus can be used to discern promoter methylation ( 32 , 33 ) .
We used AzadC to generate unmethylated DNA .

A 72 h AzadC-treatment resulted in a concentration - dependent activation of <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription in Jurkat and CML-T1 T-cells as well as in U-937 , K-562 and EM-2 cell lines ( Figure 2A ) .

text: <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription was induced in a time - dependent manner and was observed as early as 24 h after treatment with AzadC and increased over time until 72 h ( Figure 2B ) .

text: Time and strength of the appearance of <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcripts varied among cell lines , i.e . CML-T1 responded strongest to AzadC-treatment ( data not shown ) .
In line with this , AzadC-treatment of CML-T1 and LAMA-84 cells also translated in an induction of <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein expression ( Figure 2C ) .

Accordingly , treatment of the <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - positive cell line BV-173 , SD-1 and RPMI-8226 with AzadC had no effect on <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression ( Figure 2D ) .

text: There was no difference in the effects of AzaC versus AzadC , as both increased the <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA level in CML-T1 cells as well ( data not shown ) .

text: This implied that promoter methylation may control <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression , but an alternative explanation may be activation of positive transcriptional regulators of <extra_id_0> IRF-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by AzadC ( or AzaC ) .
